trigger.name: EdgeMAX: Load average is too high (per CPU load over {$LOAD_AVG_PER_CPU.MAX.WARN} for 1m)
trigger.description: Per CPU load average is too high. Your system may be slow to respond.

item.name: EdgeMAX: Total amount of available memory

trigger.name: EdgeMAX: High memory utilization ( >{$MEMORY.UTIL.MAX}% for 5m)
trigger.description: The system is running out of free memory.

trigger_prototype.name: EdgeMAX: Interface {#IFNAME} address has changed
trigger_prototype.event_name: EdgeMAX: Interface {#IFNAME} address on {HOST.HOST} has changed from {FUNCTION.VALUE2} to {FUNCTION.VALUE3}.
trigger_prototype.description: The interface address has changed. Acknowledge to close the problem manually.

trigger_prototype.name: EdgeMAX: Interface {#IFNAME} is not up (1).
trigger_prototype.event_name: EdgeMAX: Interface {#IFNAME} on {HOST.HOST} status is not up (1).
trigger_prototype.description: Interface status is not up (1). Get the interface up again to close the problem automatically.

trigger_prototype.name: EdgeMAX: Interface {#IFNAME} status has changed
trigger_prototype.event_name: EdgeMAX: Interface {#IFNAME} on {HOST.HOST} status has changed from up (1).
trigger_prototype.description: Interface status has changed from up (1). Acknowledge to close the problem manually or get the interface up again to close the problem automatically

macro.description: This macro is used as a threshold in memory utilization trigger.
This macro is used as a threshold in memory utilization trigger.

template.name: Generic by SNMP
template.description:
Template Module Generic
MIBs used: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB SNMPv2-MIB
Generated by official Zabbix template tool "Templator" 2.0.0

trigger.name: Generic SNMP: Unavailable by ICMP ping
trigger.description: Last three attempts returned timeout. Please check device connectivity.

trigger.expression: min(/Generic by SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)>{$ICMP_LOSS_WARN} and min(/Generic by SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)<100
trigger.name: Generic SNMP: High ICMP ping loss

dependency.name: Generic SNMP: Unavailable by ICMP ping

trigger.name: Generic SNMP: High ICMP ping response time

dependency.name: Generic SNMP: High ICMP ping loss
dependency.expression: min(/Generic by SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)>{$ICMP_LOSS_WARN} and min(/Generic by SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)<100

dependency.name: Generic SNMP: Unavailable by ICMP ping

item.name: Generic SNMP: SNMP traps (fallback)
item.description: The item is used to collect all SNMP traps unmatched by other snmptrap items

item.name: Generic SNMP: System contact details
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The textual identification of the contact person for this managed node, together with information on how to contact this person. If no contact information is known, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: Generic SNMP: System description
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB A textual description of the entity. This value should include the full name and version identification of the system's hardware type, software operating-system, and networking software.

item.name: Generic SNMP: Uptime (hardware)
item.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The amount of time since this host was last initialized. Note that this is different from sysUpTime in the SNMPv2-MIB [RFC1907] because sysUpTime is the uptime of the network management portion of the system.

item.name: Generic SNMP: System location
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The physical location of this node (e.g., `telephone closet, 3rd floor'). If the location is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: Generic SNMP: System name
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB An administratively-assigned name for this managed node.By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.

trigger.expression: last(/Generic by SNMP/system.name,#1)<>last(/Generic by SNMP/system.name,#2) and length(last(/Generic by SNMP/system.name))>0
trigger.name: Generic SNMP: System name has changed
trigger.event_name: Generic SNMP: System name has changed (new name: {ITEM.VALUE})
trigger.description: The name of the system has changed. Acknowledge to close the problem manually.

item.name: Generic SNMP: Uptime (network)
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The time (in hundredths of a second) since the network management portion of the system was last re-initialized.

item.name: Generic SNMP: System object ID
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The vendor's authoritative identification of the network management subsystem contained in the entity. This value is allocated within the SMI enterprises subtree (1.3.6.1.4.1) and provides an easy and unambiguous means for determining`what kind of box' is being managed. For example, if vendor`Flintstones, Inc.' was assigned the subtree1.3.6.1.4.1.4242, it could assign the identifier 1.3.6.1.4.1.4242.1.1 to its `Fred Router'.

item.name: Generic SNMP: SNMP agent availability
item.description: Availability of SNMP checks on the host. The value of this item corresponds to availability icons in the host list. Possible value: 0 - not available 1 - available 2 - unknown

trigger.name: Generic SNMP: No SNMP data collection
trigger.description: SNMP is not available for polling. Please check device connectivity and SNMP settings.

dependency.name: Generic SNMP: Unavailable by ICMP ping

trigger.expression: (last(/Generic by SNMP/system.hw.uptime[hrSystemUptime.0])>0 and last(/Generic by SNMP/system.hw.uptime[hrSystemUptime.0])<10m) or (last(/Generic by SNMP/system.hw.uptime[hrSystemUptime.0])=0 and last(/Generic by SNMP/system.net.uptime[sysUpTime.0])<10m)
trigger.name: Generic SNMP: Host has been restarted

dependency.name: Generic SNMP: No SNMP data collection
